abstracts.cdata!:
The Targeted Budget Support for National
            Education for All Plan Program Project will provide targeted
            budgetary support for selected subcomponents of the
            Educational National Targeted Program (NTP), designed to
            enhance the quality of basic education, and, will strengthen
            the administration of the Education National Targeted
            Program. In addition, the project will also promote an
            overarching policy framework in education finance, planning,
            and governance that will act as an enabling environment for
            improved service delivery. There are two project components.
            The first component will support the establishment of the
            Fundamental School Quality Level (FSQL) standard, providing
            assistance to the Education National Targeted Program. The
            component will focus on minimum service delivery criteria in
            terms of physical infrastructure, instructional materials,
            teaching staff qualifications, in-service professional
            development, school organization and management, and
            school-community linkages. It includes a framework to
            enhance teacher capacity, school leadership, and community
            participation, while promoting inclusive education for
            traditionally disenfranchised communities. The second
            component provides technical assistance, and capacity
            building to strengthen the administration, implementation
            and evaluation of the Education NTP. Project beneficiaries
            will be children attending schools being upgraded to FSQL,
            and out-of-school children who will be drawn into the
            education system through NTP interventions. Activities are
            targeted to disadvantaged groups or areas, hence, the
            beneficiary group will contain a higher proportion of poor
            children, and ethnic minorities than the population of
            Vietnam in general. This component will be financed from a
            parallel capacity building technical assistance fund. This
            capacity building facility will be predominantly reserved to
            support the central, provincial, and district levels on
            planning, procurement, financial management, and
            institutional strengthening issues, as well as to enhance
            community consultation, and empowerment. Funds will also be
            allocated to independent implementation progress reviews
            (including procurement audits), some local-level monitoring
            by social organizations (such as parent-teacher
            associations, the Vietnam Women's Union, etc.), and, to
            commission case studies on Education NTP administration,
            monitoring, and impact evaluation.
